channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Chuck Woolery, game show host of 'Love Connection' and 'Scrabble,' dies at 83
item.description: The affable, smooth-talking game show host of "Wheel of Fortune," "Love Connection" and "Scrabble" later became a right-wing podcaster.
item.content:encoded:
The affable, smooth-talking game show host of "Wheel of Fortune," "Love Connection" and "Scrabble" later became a right-wing podcaster.

(Image credit: Ronda Churchill)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: 2 Dartmouth fraternity members and a sorority have been charged in death of a student
item.description: The Alpha Phi sorority and two members of Beta Alpha Omega have been charged after a student was found dead in a river after attending an off-campus party where alcohol was allegedly served to minors.
item.content:encoded:
The Alpha Phi sorority and two members of Beta Alpha Omega have been charged after a student was found dead in a river after attending an off-campus party where alcohol was allegedly served to minors.

(Image credit: Charles Krupa)
item.dc:creator: Chandelis Duster

item.title: A new installation lets you hear extinct and endangered animal sounds, thanks to Björk
item.description: The Icelandic pop star Björk's new installation at Centre Pompidou in Paris uses animal sounds to help people understand what's lost and what we stand to lose as a result of human-caused climate change.
item.content:encoded:
Nature Manifesto, is currently playing for visitors who travel on the escalator at Paris' Centre Pompidou.'/>

The Icelandic pop star Björk's new installation at Centre Pompidou in Paris uses animal sounds to help people understand what's lost and what we stand to lose as a result of human-caused climate change.

(Image credit: Manuel Braun)
item.dc:creator: Chloe Veltman

item.title: Fold paper. Insert lens. This $2 microscope changes how kids see the world
item.description: The Foldscope brings a powerful science tool to schools that can't afford microscopes. Scientists use it too. Its creators have handed out 2 million units, including a new mini-model for younger kids.
item.content:encoded:
The Foldscope brings a powerful science tool to schools that can't afford microscopes. Scientists use it too. Its creators have handed out 2 million units, including a new mini-model for younger kids.

(Image credit: Viraj Nayer for NPR)
item.dc:creator: Kamala Thiagarajan

item.title: Israeli strike kills Lebanese soldier as Hezbollah fires rockets at Israel
item.description: An Israeli strike on a Lebanese army center on Sunday killed one soldier and wounded 18 others, the Lebanese military said.
item.content:encoded:
An Israeli strike on a Lebanese army center on Sunday killed one soldier and wounded 18 others, the Lebanese military said.

(Image credit: Oded Balilty/AP)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: A photographer's devastating documentation of El Salvador's civil war in the 1980s
item.description: In Legacy of Lies, El Salvador 1981-1984, photojournalist Robert Nickelsberg documents how U.S. foreign policy fueled a violent 13-year civil war in El Salvador.
item.content:encoded:
In Legacy of Lies, El Salvador 1981-1984, photojournalist Robert Nickelsberg documents how U.S. foreign policy fueled a violent 13-year civil war in El Salvador.

(Image credit: Robert Nickelsberg)
item.dc:creator: Robert Nickelsberg

item.title: Jimmy O. Yang opens up about one of his deepest fears
item.description: Actor Jimmy O. Yang is learning how to take compliments. On Wild Card this week, he opens up about love languages and fears.
item.content:encoded:
Actor Jimmy O. Yang is learning how to take compliments. On Wild Card this week, he opens up about love languages and fears.

(Image credit: Mike Taing)
item.dc:creator: Rachel Martin

item.title: With talks teetering, climate negotiators struck a controversial $300 billion deal
item.description: Representatives of developing countries and climate activists were furious over the outcome, saying $300 billion annually from industrialized countries is far short of what vulnerable nations need to better protect themselves from climate change.
item.content:encoded:
Representatives of developing countries and climate activists were furious over the outcome, saying $300 billion annually from industrialized countries is far short of what vulnerable nations need to better protect themselves from climate change.

(Image credit: Sean Gallup/Getty Images)
item.dc:creator: Michael Copley

item.title: In 'Points North' podcast, researchers try to save ash trees from extinction
item.dc:creator: Mallory Yu

item.title: Alcohol poisoning deaths in Laos renew concerns about methanol. Here's what to know
item.description: The U.S., Australia and U.K. have issued warnings for travelers in Vang Vieng after several tourists died in a suspected methanol poisoning outbreak.
item.content:encoded:
The U.S., Australia and U.K. have issued warnings for travelers in Vang Vieng after several tourists died in a suspected methanol poisoning outbreak.

(Image credit: Anupam Nath)
item.dc:creator: Juliana Kim
